segment_text: In this I was asked to sit, and then Mr. Rucastle, walking up and down on the other side of the room, began to tell me a series of the funniest stories that I have ever listened to.

segment_text: You cannot imagine how comical he was, and I laughed until I was quite weary. Mrs. Rucastle, however, who has evidently no sense of humour, never so much as smiled, but sat with her hands in her lap, and a sad, anxious look upon her face.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, three long windows, chair by window

segment_text: Then he handed me a yellow-backed novel, and moving my chair a little sideways, that my own shadow might not fall upon the page, he begged me to read aloud to him.

segment_text: They were always very careful, I observed, to turn my face away from the window, so that I became consumed with the desire to see what was going on behind my back.

segment_text: At the second glance, however, I perceived that there was a man standing in the Southampton Road, a small bearded man in a grey suit, who seemed to be looking in my direction.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, three long windows, chair by window

segment_text: The road is an important highway, and there are usually people there. This man, however, was leaning against the railings which bordered our field and was looking earnestly up.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, three long windows, chair by window

segment_text: “The warning was no idle one, for two nights later I happened to look out of my bedroom window about two o’clock in the morning.

segment_text: It walked slowly across the lawn and vanished into the shadow upon the other side. That dreadful sentinel sent a chill to my heart which I do not think that any burglar could have done.

scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: One evening, after the child was in bed, I began to amuse myself by examining the furniture of my room and by rearranging my own little things.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: There was an old chest of drawers in the room, the two upper ones empty and open, the lower one locked. I had filled the first two with my linen, and as I had still much to pack away I was naturally annoyed at not having the use of the third drawer.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: It struck me that it might have been fastened by a mere oversight, so I took out my bunch of keys and tried to open it.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: The very first key fitted to perfection, and I drew the drawer open. There was only one thing in it, but I am sure that you would never guess what it was.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: It was my coil of hair. “I took it up and examined it. It was of the same peculiar tint, and the same thickness.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: But then the impossibility of the thing obtruded itself upon me. How could my hair have been locked in the drawer?
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: With trembling hands I undid my trunk, turned out the contents, and drew from the bottom my own hair. I laid the two tresses together, and I assure you that they were identical.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: Was it not extraordinary? Puzzle as I would, I could make nothing at all of what it meant.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: I returned the strange hair to the drawer, and I said nothing of the matter to the Rucastles as I felt that I had put myself in the wrong by opening a drawer which they had locked.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: “I am naturally observant, as you may have remarked, Mr. Holmes, and I soon had a pretty good plan of the whole house in my head.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: There was one wing, however, which appeared not to be inhabited at all. A door which faced that which led into the quarters of the Tollers opened into this suite, but it was invariably locked.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: One day, however, as I ascended the stair, I met Mr. Rucastle coming out through this door, his keys in his hand, and a look on his face which made him a very different person to the round, jovial man to whom I was accustomed.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: His cheeks were red, his brow was all crinkled with anger, and the veins stood out at his temples with passion. He locked the door and hurried past me without a word or a look.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “This aroused my curiosity, so when I went out for a walk in the grounds with my charge, I strolled round to the side from which I could see the windows of this part of the house.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: There were four of them in a row, three of which were simply dirty, while the fourth was shuttered up. They were evidently all deserted.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: As I strolled up and down, glancing at them occasionally, Mr. Rucastle came out to me, looking as merry and jovial as ever.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: “‘Ah!’ said he, ‘you must not think me rude if I passed you without a word, my dear young lady. I was preoccupied with business matters.’
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: “I assured him that I was not offended. ‘By the way,’ said I, ‘you seem to have quite a suite of spare rooms up there, and one of them has the shutters up.’
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: “He looked surprised and, as it seemed to me, a little startled at my remark.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: “‘Photography is one of my hobbies,’ said he. ‘I have made my dark room up there. But, dear me! what an observant young lady we have come upon.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: Who would have believed it? Who would have ever believed it?’ He spoke in a jesting tone, but there was no jest in his eyes as he looked at me.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: I read suspicion there and annoyance, but no jest.
scene_description: outdoors, side of house, four dirty windows, one shuttered window

segment_text: “Well, Mr. Holmes, from the moment that I understood that there was something about that suite of rooms which I was not to know, I was all on fire to go over them.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: It was not mere curiosity, though I have my share of that. It was more a feeling of duty—a feeling that some good might come from my penetrating to this place.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: They talk of woman’s instinct; perhaps it was woman’s instinct which gave me that feeling. At any rate, it was there, and I was keenly on the lookout for any chance to pass the forbidden door.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “It was only yesterday that the chance came. I may tell you that, besides Mr. Rucastle, both Toller and his wife find something to do in these deserted rooms, and I once saw him carrying a large black linen bag with him through the door.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: Recently he has been drinking hard, and yesterday evening he was very drunk; and when I came upstairs there was the key in the door. I have no doubt at all that he had left it there.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: Mr. and Mrs. Rucastle were both downstairs, and the child was with them, so that I had an admirable opportunity.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: I turned the key gently in the lock, opened the door, and slipped through.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: “There was a little passage in front of me, unpapered and uncarpeted, which turned at a right angle at the farther end.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: Round this corner were three doors in a line, the first and third of which were open. They each led into an empty room, dusty and cheerless, with two windows in the one and one in the other, so thick with dirt that the evening light glimmered dimly through them.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: The centre door was closed, and across the outside of it had been fastened one of the broad bars of an iron bed, padlocked at one end to a ring in the wall, and fastened at the other with stout cord.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: The door itself was locked as well, and the key was not there. This barricaded door corresponded clearly with the shuttered window outside, and yet I could see by the glimmer from beneath it that the room was not in darkness.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: Evidently there was a skylight which let in light from above.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: As I stood in the passage gazing at the sinister door and wondering what secret it might veil, I suddenly heard the sound of steps within the room and saw a shadow pass backward and forward against the little slit of dim light which shone out from under the door.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: A mad, unreasoning terror rose up in me at the sight, Mr. Holmes. My overstrung nerves failed me suddenly, and I turned and ran—ran as though some dreadful hand were behind me clutching at the skirt of my dress.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, three doors, dusty floor

segment_text: I rushed down the passage, through the door, and straight into the arms of Mr. Rucastle, who was waiting outside.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘So,’ said he, smiling, ‘it was you, then. I thought that it must be when I saw the door open.’
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘Oh, I am so frightened!’ I panted. “‘My dear young lady! my dear young lady!’—you cannot think how caressing and soothing his manner was—‘and what has frightened you, my dear young lady?’
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “But his voice was just a little too coaxing. He overdid it. I was keenly on my guard against him.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘I was foolish enough to go into the empty wing,’ I answered. ‘But it is so lonely and eerie in this dim light that I was frightened and ran out again. Oh, it is so dreadfully still in there!’
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘Only that?’ said he, looking at me keenly. “‘Why, what did you think?’ I asked.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘Why do you think that I lock this door?’ “‘I am sure that I do not know.’
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘It is to keep people out who have no business there. Do you see?’ He was still smiling in the most amiable manner.
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “‘I am sure if I had known—’ “‘Well, then, you know now. And if you ever put your foot over that threshold again’—here in an instant the smile hardened into a grin of rage, and he glared down at me with the face of a demon—‘I’ll throw you to the mastiff.’
scene_description: indoors, upstairs hallway, locked wooden door, plain walls

segment_text: “I was so terrified that I do not know what I did. I suppose that I must have rushed past him into my room.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: I remember nothing until I found myself lying on my bed trembling all over. Then I thought of you, Mr. Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: I could not live there longer without some advice. I was frightened of the house, of the man, of the woman, of the servants, even of the child.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: They were all horrible to me. If I could only bring you down all would be well.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: Of course I might have fled from the house, but my curiosity was almost as strong as my fears. My mind was soon made up.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: I would send you a wire. I put on my hat and cloak, went down to the office, which is about half a mile from the house, and then returned, feeling very much easier.
scene_description: outdoors, small rural office building, dusty path, sparse trees

segment_text: A horrible doubt came into my mind as I approached the door lest the dog might be loose, but I remembered that Toller had drunk himself into a state of insensibility that evening, and I knew that he was the only one in the household who had any influence with the savage creature, or who would venture to set him free.
scene_description: outdoors, house silhouette, dark grounds, moonlight, path to door

segment_text: I slipped in in safety and lay awake half the night in my joy at the thought of seeing you.
scene_description: indoors, bedroom, old chest of drawers, open trunk, window

segment_text: I had no difficulty in getting leave to come into Winchester this morning, but I must be back before three o’clock, for Mr. and Mrs. Rucastle are going on a visit, and will be away all the evening, so that I must look after the child.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: Now I have told you all my adventures, Mr. Holmes, and I should be very glad if you could tell me what it all means, and, above all, what I should do.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: Holmes and I had listened spellbound to this extraordinary story. My friend rose now and paced up and down the room, his hands in his pockets, and an expression of the most profound gravity upon his face.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “Is Toller still drunk?” he asked. “Yes. I heard his wife tell Mrs. Rucastle that she could do nothing with him.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “That is well. And the Rucastles go out to-night?” “Yes.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “Is there a cellar with a good strong lock?” “Yes, the wine-cellar.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “You seem to me to have acted all through this matter like a very brave and sensible girl, Miss Hunter. Do you think that you could perform one more feat?
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: I should not ask it of you if I did not think you a quite exceptional woman.” “I will try. What is it?”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “We shall be at the Copper Beeches by seven o’clock, my friend and I. The Rucastles will be gone by that time, and Toller will, we hope, be incapable.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: There only remains Mrs. Toller, who might give the alarm. If you could send her into the cellar on some errand, and then turn the key upon her, you would facilitate matters immensely.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “I will do it.” “Excellent! We shall then look thoroughly into the affair.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: Of course there is only one feasible explanation. You have been brought there to personate someone, and the real person is imprisoned in this chamber.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: That is obvious. As to who this prisoner is, I have no doubt that it is the daughter, Miss Alice Rucastle, if I remember right, who was said to have gone to America.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: You were chosen, doubtless, as resembling her in height, figure, and the colour of your hair. Hers had been cut off, very possibly in some illness through which she has passed, and so, of course, yours had to be sacrificed also.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: By a curious chance you came upon her tresses. The man in the road was undoubtedly some friend of hers—possibly her _fiancé_—and no doubt, as you wore the girl’s dress and were so like her, he was convinced from your laughter, whenever he saw you, and afterwards from your gesture, that Miss Rucastle was perfectly happy, and that she no longer desired his attentions.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: The dog is let loose at night to prevent him from endeavouring to communicate with her. So much is fairly clear.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: The most serious point in the case is the disposition of the child.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “What on earth has that to do with it?” I ejaculated.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “My dear Watson, you as a medical man are continually gaining light as to the tendencies of a child by the study of the parents. Don’t you see that the converse is equally valid.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: I have frequently gained my first real insight into the character of parents by studying their children.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: This child’s disposition is abnormally cruel, merely for cruelty’s sake, and whether he derives this from his smiling father, as I should suspect, or from his mother, it bodes evil for the poor girl who is in their power.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “I am sure that you are right, Mr. Holmes,” cried our client. “A thousand things come back to me which make me certain that you have hit it.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: Oh, let us lose not an instant in bringing help to this poor creature.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: “We must be circumspect, for we are dealing with a very cunning man. We can do nothing until seven o’clock.
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: At that hour we shall be with you, and it will not be long before we solve the mystery.”
scene_description: indoors, inn sitting-room, set table, fireplace

segment_text: We were as good as our word, for it was just seven when we reached the Copper Beeches, having put up our trap at a wayside public-house.
scene_description: outdoors, large square house, setting sun, burnished leaves, doorstep

segment_text: The group of trees, with their dark leaves shining like burnished metal in the light of the setting sun, were sufficient to mark the house even had Miss Hunter not been standing smiling on the door-step.
scene_description: outdoors, large square house, setting sun, burnished leaves, doorstep

segment_text: “Have you managed it?” asked Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, large square house, setting sun, burnished leaves, doorstep

segment_text: A loud thudding noise came from somewhere downstairs. “That is Mrs. Toller in the cellar,” said she.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen or hall area, rug on floor, cellar doorway

segment_text: “Her husband lies snoring on the kitchen rug. Here are his keys, which are the duplicates of Mr. Rucastle’s.”
scene_description: indoors, kitchen or hall area, rug on floor, cellar doorway

segment_text: “You have done well indeed!” cried Holmes with enthusiasm. “Now lead the way, and we shall soon see the end of this black business.”
scene_description: indoors, kitchen or hall area, rug on floor, cellar doorway

segment_text: We passed up the stair, unlocked the door, followed on down a passage, and found ourselves in front of the barricade which Miss Hunter had described.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, barricaded door with cord

segment_text: Holmes cut the cord and removed the transverse bar. Then he tried the various keys in the lock, but without success.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, barricaded door with cord

segment_text: No sound came from within, and at the silence Holmes’ face clouded over.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, barricaded door with cord

segment_text: “I trust that we are not too late,” said he. “I think, Miss Hunter, that we had better go in without you.
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, barricaded door with cord

segment_text: Now, Watson, put your shoulder to it, and we shall see whether we cannot make our way in.”
scene_description: indoors, dim passage, unpapered walls, barricaded door with cord

segment_text: It was an old rickety door and gave at once before our united strength. Together we rushed into the room.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: It was empty. There was no furniture save a little pallet bed, a small table, and a basketful of linen.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: The skylight above was open, and the prisoner gone.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “There has been some villainy here,” said Holmes; “this beauty has guessed Miss Hunter’s intentions and has carried his victim off.”
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “But how?” “Through the skylight. We shall soon see how he managed it.”
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: He swung himself up onto the roof. “Ah, yes,” he cried, “here’s the end of a long light ladder against the eaves.
scene_description: outdoors, rooftop, house eaves, ladder against eaves, dim light

segment_text: That is how he did it.”
scene_description: outdoors, rooftop, house eaves, ladder against eaves, dim light

segment_text: “But it is impossible,” said Miss Hunter; “the ladder was not there when the Rucastles went away.”
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “He has come back and done it. I tell you that he is a clever and dangerous man.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: I should not be very much surprised if this were he whose step I hear now upon the stair. I think, Watson, that it would be as well for you to have your pistol ready.”
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: The words were hardly out of his mouth before a man appeared at the door of the room, a very fat and burly man, with a heavy stick in his hand.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: Miss Hunter screamed and shrunk against the wall at the sight of him, but Sherlock Holmes sprang forward and confronted him.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “You villain!” said he, “where’s your daughter?”
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: The fat man cast his eyes round, and then up at the open skylight. “It is for me to ask you that,” he shrieked, “you thieves! Spies and thieves!
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: I have caught you, have I? You are in my power. I’ll serve you!” He turned and clattered down the stairs as hard as he could go.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “He’s gone for the dog!” cried Miss Hunter.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “I have my revolver,” said I.
scene_description: indoors, empty room, pallet bed, small table, open skylight

segment_text: “Better close the front door,” cried Holmes, and we all rushed down the stairs together. We had hardly reached the hall when we heard the baying of a hound, and then a scream of agony, with a horrible worrying sound which it was dreadful to listen to.
scene_description: indoors, house hall, staircase, side door, shadowy interior

segment_text: An elderly man with a red face and shaking limbs came staggering out at a side door.
scene_description: indoors, house hall, staircase, side door, shadowy interior

segment_text: “My God!” he cried. “Someone has loosed the dog. It’s not been fed for two days. Quick, quick, or it’ll be too late!”
scene_description: indoors, house hall, staircase, side door, shadowy interior

segment_text: Holmes and I rushed out and round the angle of the house, with Toller hurrying behind us. There was the huge famished brute, its black muzzle buried in Rucastle’s throat, while he writhed and screamed upon the ground.
scene_description: outdoors, house corner, dark lawn, overgrown bushes, faint ambient light

segment_text: Running up, I blew its brains out, and it fell over with its keen white teeth still meeting in the great creases of his neck.
scene_description: outdoors, house corner, dark lawn, overgrown bushes, faint ambient light

segment_text: With much labour we separated them and carried him, living but horribly mangled, into the house. We laid him upon the drawing-room sofa, and having dispatched the sobered Toller to bear the news to his wife, I did what I could to relieve his pain.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: We were all assembled round him when the door opened, and a tall, gaunt woman entered the room. “Mrs. Toller!” cried Miss Hunter.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Yes, miss. Mr. Rucastle let me out when he came back before he went up to you. Ah, miss, it is a pity you didn’t let me know what you were planning, for I would have told you that your pains were wasted.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Ha!” said Holmes, looking keenly at her. “It is clear that Mrs. Toller knows more about this matter than anyone else.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Yes, sir, I do, and I am ready enough to tell what I know.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Then, pray, sit down, and let us hear it for there are several points on which I must confess that I am still in the dark.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “I will soon make it clear to you,” said she; “and I’d have done so before now if I could ha’ got out from the cellar. If there’s police-court business over this, you’ll remember that I was the one that stood your friend, and that I was Miss Alice’s friend too.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “She was never happy at home, Miss Alice wasn’t, from the time that her father married again. She was slighted like and had no say in anything, but it never really became bad for her until after she met Mr. Fowler at a friend’s house.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: As well as I could learn, Miss Alice had rights of her own by will, but she was so quiet and patient, she was, that she never said a word about them but just left everything in Mr. Rucastle’s hands.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: He knew he was safe with her; but when there was a chance of a husband coming forward, who would ask for all that the law would give him, then her father thought it time to put a stop on it. He wanted her to sign a paper, so that whether she married or not, he could use her money.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: When she wouldn’t do it, he kept on worrying her until she got brain-fever, and for six weeks was at death’s door. Then she got better at last, all worn to a shadow, and with her beautiful hair cut off; but that didn’t make no change in her young man, and he stuck to her as true as man could be.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Ah,” said Holmes, “I think that what you have been good enough to tell us makes the matter fairly clear, and that I can deduce all that remains. Mr. Rucastle then, I presume, took to this system of imprisonment?”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Yes, sir.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “And brought Miss Hunter down from London in order to get rid of the disagreeable persistence of Mr. Fowler.” “That was it, sir.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “But Mr. Fowler being a persevering man, as a good seaman should be, blockaded the house, and having met you succeeded by certain arguments, metallic or otherwise, in convincing you that your interests were the same as his.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “Mr. Fowler was a very kind-spoken, free-handed gentleman,” said Mrs. Toller serenely.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “And in this way he managed that your good man should have no want of drink, and that a ladder should be ready at the moment when your master had gone out.” “You have it, sir, just as it happened.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: “I am sure we owe you an apology, Mrs. Toller,” said Holmes, “for you have certainly cleared up everything which puzzled us. And here comes the country surgeon and Mrs. Rucastle, so I think, Watson, that we had best escort Miss Hunter back to Winchester, as it seems to me that our _locus standi_ now is rather a questionable one.”
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: And thus was solved the mystery of the sinister house with the copper beeches in front of the door.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: Mr. Rucastle survived, but was always a broken man, kept alive solely through the care of his devoted wife. They still live with their old servants, who probably know so much of Rucastle’s past life that he finds it difficult to part from them.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: Mr. Fowler and Miss Rucastle were married, by special license, in Southampton the day after their flight, and he is now the holder of a government appointment in the island of Mauritius.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture

segment_text: As to Miss Violet Hunter, my friend Holmes, rather to my disappointment, manifested no further interest in her when once she had ceased to be the centre of one of his problems, and she is now the head of a private school at Walsall, where I believe that she has met with considerable success.
scene_description: indoors, large drawing-room, sofa, tall dark windows, period furniture
